job_title: Pharmacy Technician in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Culture is great, pharmacists are fantastic to work for
cons: Retail pharmacy not open long hours and has to be staffed by inpatient

job_title: Patient Access Specialist in Saint Paul, MN
pros: The best part about the job are the friendly coworkers and a great work environment. This is what makes it bearable to come to work. The coworkers are very supportive and helpful. I can rely on them more than the management if I have any questions or concerns.
cons: Terrible Management. They don't care about employee’s satisfaction. They only care about the numbers of bodies to fill up for shifts, and don't value/overlook those who goes above and beyond their work tasks. There's countless times where employees don't get breaks and often work two people’s job. Management aren't reliable, they all have different answers to a question and take forever to reply back. They reach out very quick to you if they need you, but they take forever to help you with your concerns. The managements hate being bothered if it's not “urgent” to them. If you have questions, better ask for help elsewhere else first and read the handbook before calling them for help.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Minneapolis, MN

job_title: Registered Nurse in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Currently has a pick up bonus. I was making $106/hr if I picked up on my weekends off.
cons: SO many. They treat their nurses as an afterthought. So many new people quit during orientation or they fire them for really stupid reasons. The insurance is crap. Work-life balance sucks, they’re so short staffed there’s no opportunity to use your PTO unless you call in. Patient safety is definitely not a priority. The director of pediatrics was calling charge nurses one busy weekend to see how many kids they could safely take. Everyone was full so the director said, “I’ll rephrase, how many kids can you kind-of safely take?”. I’ll never bring my kids here again for anything or recommend it to anyone. It’s a dumpster fire.

Fantastic co-workers
The best patients
MNA contracts good salary and benefits

*Poor transparency from upper administration regarding future hospital plans resulting in employee dissatisfaction.

*Staffing shortage of nurses across all hospital units since March/April 2021.

job_title: Float Nurse in Minneapolis, MN
pros: what the org was meant to do - be there for the kids
cons: leadership lost sight of the mission and vision of this org. there is no direction forward with the mass layoffs and restructuring happening this year. everyone seems to be walking on eggshells and working in fear and sadness. managers are not compassionate or caring about us as people in the decisions they make and how they announce changes and deliver news. bullying and playing favorites is not uncommon here. career growth is not available to everybody. morale ebbs and flows but is generally always low, some departments more than others. nurse units can be very cliquey when you float. each person fends for their own, there is no real teamwork. new director and revolving door in pharmacy makes them extremely difficult to work with and get the meds to the patients. no continuity, the good ones always seem to leave. getting prepared to leave myself

review_title: Worst work environment ran by rude old lady
job_title: HUC/Front Desk Medical Receptionist in Hugo, MN
pros: You meet a lot of good people that come into the clinic. Benefits are not bad. Easy to find parking.
cons:
No free coffee to staff or patient's
If you want to kiss butt your whole life or don't mind being a pet to a senior receptionist/HUC then this is the job for you! 
Seniority for vacations- hope they like you or you will be mad when you get denied.
Coworkers are vary negative to one another and two faced no loyalty 
Too many women that want power in one small place.
No laughing at work per manager "not appropriate"
No talking to the medical assistants that get the patient's per manager.
Rude snotty behavior from staff.
Medical professionals do not address staff in friendly manner and ignore you
Front desk staff is miserable because of long time coworker set in her ways and takes a long time to complete tasks.
Manager is not qualified and no problem solving skills.
Manager influences conflicts and does not resolve employee conflicts.
Manager pushes staff out the door with harassment.
Manager is also a medical assistant.
Manager never takes same day complaints of patient's and leaves it up to front desk staff to resolve issues. 
MD's are always running late
unorganized place that has no empathy

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Latest technology + specialization with children allows for an excellent care model.  Funds are available for special research projects and there are opportunities to implement change through unit councils.  The organization works hard to implement the latest evidence-based practices in each department.  I love my job and there are many opportunities to grow for many years to come.
cons: As with most healthcare organizations, there is always change to adapt to as well as negativity among some staff members. It can really bring others down.  Additionally, I see a disconnect between upper-level management and frontline care.  I also believe there could be more diversity in the workforce at Children's to match the populations we serve.

review_title: What Went Wrong With Children's Hospital?
job_title: Respiratory Care Practitioner in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Working with children is the best when working in healthcare. They are resilient and joyful even when facing illness.
cons: Upper management seems to hire the same people over and over. Only the names and faces change. I have been there 20 yrs and have had over 30 different supervisors, managers, assistant directors, and directors. My dept is currently under nursing and she is too busy to realize the damage two of the current three sups are causing. If we try to get in to see her, our sup knows about it before it happens because her assistant calls and tells them. The most recent CEO never saw a photo op he didn't like. Bonuses in place over 20 yrs have been taken away. There are only four people with more seniority than me left. two years ago it was twelve!

review_title: Terrible! Longevity means nothing - supervisor expects a stopwatch at desk even for going to the bathroom!
job_title: Transcriptionist in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Wonderful doctors and great medical care of Children and families -
cons: Poor treatment of employees, especially long term ones. Many management employees need to be replaced because they do not appreciate employees - especially long term ones - management is only concerned with making themselves look better without any regard to employees they supervise, family needs, struggles with learning new tasks, etc. - they would rather get rid of you than allow the extra time needed to learn. Human resources is not supportive of employees at all when issue of poor supervisor/management is brought up. Several dedicated long term employees are leaving - if they are not fired first for complaining!

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Truly get to see amazing things happen every day. All of the people on the front lines truly love what they do and go above and beyond to help kids and families cope with being there.
cons: Like every healthcare system, it’s becoming more about the business than it is about the mission. The frontline team is great, but the upper management makes decisions about the care we give without consulting us. The CEO may be very smart, but no parent wants him making decisions on the day to day care of their child.

review_title: I enjoy working at Childrens—been there over 15 years. It
job_title: Staff RN in Roseville, MN
pros: There is a positive environment where colleagues help and want you to succeed. The union contract prevents mandatory overtime and protects/backs up their nurses. We have nursing governance councils, an evidence -based practice program. Nursing certification is encouraged, testing and review classes reimbursed and a yearly bonus given for currently held certifications. We in in the process of obtaining Magnet designation.
cons: We have 2 campuses—St Paul and Minneapolis and it’s taking some time for both campuses to get to the same practices.

review_title: A great community of employees driven to make a difference.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Work/life balance, opportunities for growth, projects are engaging, innovative and centered around improving the lives of children. Who wouldn't want to work towards that?
cons: The pay is below industry standards, but they are not unwilling to make adjustments is the research is done for them.

job_title: Staff RN in Minneapolis, MN
pros: The opportunity to work with amazing kids has been the highlight of my career. I have gained invaluable skills and knowledge that have enriched me personally and professionally.
cons: Children's has put a very heavy focus on their outward appearance to the public, but behind the doors operates very inefficiently. Management does not include input from staff regarding changes or needs. Staffing on the inpatient units continues to run short and these things make it difficult to put 'Children first' as the mission states. I am continually hopeful for the future of Children's as I have invested a substantial amount of time into the organization.

job_title: Clinical Support Associate in Minneapolis, MN
pros: The children are amazing. It feels wonderful to be able to care for kids going through a rough time. I enjoyed holding babies, and meeting different children. The nurses are often very nice and caring people, and fun to work with. There are a few bad apples here and there, but most of the nurses are nice.
cons: Some nurses and CSA's are the picky type who overreact to small things- with a negative and judgmental attitude. For example, if you accidentally wear a tight scrub top- maybe you put on some weight, then they would report that and it ends up on your record. The management  is often picky and looks for things that people are doing wrong- it can be a stressful environment to work because of this. There is more of a focus on rules and details then supporting employee's. I actually had to quit because they were not willing to let me go become a casual worker, and my school load was over whelming in my last semester at school. I ended up going through a year and a half of really difficult job searching/underemployment/depression because I didn't have the support I needed when I requested  flexible hours. Some favored employee's will probably report they had a different experience. I was not in nursing school so I think, I was less valued- they knew I would leave eventually. The kids are such a positive that despite the negativity from management, I give this place 3 stars.

review_title: Life changing healthcare for our smallest patients!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Minneapolis, MN
pros: I've been with Children's for almost 6 years and this has been the longest I've been at a job before.  I believe the reason I have been here so long is because I truly believe that what I do has an impact on our patients.  I truly believe in our mission.  It's difficult to find another job where you receive as much fulfillment for day-in-day-out.
cons: Budgets are always tight.  It's hard to sometime provide the best backend infrastructure when you don't have the money to buy what is needed (this isn't related to patient care, more on the IT side of things).

job_title: in Minneapolis, MN
pros: I worked there for 20 years.  Outstanding care of children and would highly recommend to anyone. I thought pay was good and flexibility of hours was good.
cons: Now work for Gillette - and the difference is light night and day.  Gillette is outstanding - wish I had found it years ago.  Far better pay, benefits and treatment of employees in general.  Lots of room for advancement.  Supervisors, managers, department heads and CEO truly appreciate their employees and demonstrate it every day. Care of children with unique needs is outstanding and they truly understand and recognize what parents are dealing with as well.  The way employees are treated/respected/compensated results in even better patient care.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Registered Nurses are offered great benefits thanks to our union contract!  Staff RNs, CSAs, house keeping and volunteers contribute so much to the work environment, which makes it a positive place to be!
cons: Management has made it difficult to balance work/life commitments due to limited approved vacation hours and primarily offering only 12 hour shifts.

review_title: A Great Mission to Help Children but Needs More Clear Direction for Staff
job_title: in Minneapolis, MN
pros:
Employees are dedicated to the work - helping children heal.  There are a lot of wonderful, talented individuals and we are an award winning organization!

I believe in Children's mission and vision.
cons: Sometimes there is a disconnect between senior leadership and the "'worker bees".  Not all of the departments work well together.  There are "silos".

job_title: Clinical Research Associate I in Minneapolis, MN
pros:
Rewarding/fulfilling work
Competitive pay
Competitive benefits
Excellent people to work with. Every employee works hard to make this hospital better every day and improve outcomes for the children that come here
cons: Economic constraints and rising healthcare costs have led to drastic budget cut backs. Many employees will feel the effects of more expensive health plans and reduced benefits.

job_title: HUC in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Making lifelong friends with my former coworkers, and providers. Direct management was also great. Flexible with scheduling shifts and with communication.
cons: Management didn't take employee opinion. Didn't seem to care if we were unhappy with how things were done. Decisions made for change were never good because the people making the decisions weren't doing the front line things they were making those decisions on. I also disagree with the "market research" on pay.

job_title: Registered Nurse Acute Care Pediatrics in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Mostly awesome professional staff. Nursing has young and old divisions.  Work ethics have changed greatly.  Served great patients and families. Worked there in multiple settings many years.
cons: Management operates like high school with cliques. Allowed and directed "Bullying" to meet cost saving agendas.  Managers minions of leadership & HR - have directives to save money.  MNA in with Childrens; not your friends just getting 2K a year of your money for nothing.  Watch your back- no run.  There are better places to work.

job_title: ECMO RN in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Growing into a more corporate entity: evidence-based practice changes are leading to improved patient outcomes making us feel better about the work we do all the time.
cons: Growing into a more corporate entity: politics and bottom line drive decisions leading to increased staff mistrust of leadership.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Lino Lakes, MN
pros: Pay well.  Strong community of nurses.  Many opportunities for education and advancement.  Flexible scheduling and easy to change schedule with trades or switches.
cons: Poor support of nurses when they need help with personal issues affecting their job.  DON out of touch.  Staffing is becoming poor.  Most management out of touch with bedside care.

review_title: overall a great place to work.
job_title: Health Unit Coordinator in Minneapolis, MN
pros: I loved my co-workers if you needed help they were willing and ready, would stop what they were doing to help you if needed. I also loved the families that I got to know.
cons: My con was my long commute each day, but I still loved my job because I stayed for 10 years.

job_title: Medical Laboratory Scientist in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Great mission and values!  Children's has very skilled, highly qualified providers, nurses and technologists.  It has state of the art technology and pay is competitive.  Very rewarding place to work, especially if you like working with children.
cons: The organization has silos (departments don't work as collaboratively together as they should), but they working on that with a new/revamped HR department and new Values that people are being held accountable to.

review_title: Management varies by department. Mine was collaborative and people-focused, and I enjoyed my work.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN
pros:
Each department is different, but many are supportive of work-life balance,  and have a positive approach to professional development.
The large organization is capable of doing big things in the community and for families.
Family centered care is a huge focus, and interactions with families and patients can be incredible.
cons: The leadership can seem disconnected at times from the daily work of employees. Hospitals are hierarchical settings.

job_title: IT Projects in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Giving back to the community. Feel good organization.  Some employees have been here for many years.
cons: Look at the bottom line over valuing employees.  Famous for moving bad employees around to various departments and keeping bad managers even with high turn over and years if complaints. Very few PTO days. Very slow to implement change.

job_title: Database Administrator in Saint Paul, MN
pros: I love the cause I work for - championing the best healthcare outcomes for children.  I work in the foundation, which helps raise money for the non-profit hospital.  My co-workers are all great, passionate people.
cons: The hierarchy of upper management is a little excessive for my tastes.  I would prefer a more horizontal management style.

job_title: Director in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Children's has a great mission and does a lot of good things for the community and children
cons: Leadership at this organization is lacking integrity, experience and general knowledge of business growth and development of employees. Lots of preference toward leaders who have been at the organization for a long time, not a lot of interest in new ideas or different opinions. Bias based on diversity of ideas that do not 'fit' with Children's way.

job_title: Senior Development Associate in Edina, MN
pros: You truly feel good about the mission of the company and you can see the mission being valued in everyone's work.  Great, passionate co-workers. The company is also well respected in the community. Nearly everyone is connected to the hospital in some way.
cons: Leadership is under a lot of change right now, along with healthcare, so there is some uncertainty at the moment.

job_title: Clinic Assistant in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Amazing patients and families, good benefits, company pride
cons: Poor leadership, over worked and under staffed employees, focus by management on outward appearances and not on creating a healthy work environment, minimal employee appreciation

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Minneapolis, MN
pros: If you are related to someone on the management team, you will have no problems with your employment.
cons: Poor Management, management that completely disregards company policies

job_title: CSA in Minneapolis, MN
pros: The people are great, units stick together, set schedule can have it rotate if that works best.
cons: Other units are stand offish, dealing with children as patients is difficult but dealing with their parents is harder. To break a parent heart with bad news is the worst.

review_title: A little hectic sometimes, but fun people to work with
job_title: Lab Associate II in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Nice people. Good pay. Many helpful individuals.
cons: Lab manager is two-faced. Have to work seven days in a row a lot.

job_title: Child Life in Minneapolis, MN
pros: People are genuinely committed to their work.  There is a high level of professionalism, and a culture of support and quality.
cons: People work hard at Children's Hospital and Clinics of MN.  If you are a slacker this is not the place for you.

job_title: Staff RN in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Children's provides good training to staff.  Working with children is rewarding.  You work with a team that is providing quality care.
cons: Management of often not supportive or encouraging.  As a staff member you often go along with the herd and hear much for overall negative feedback than positive.

review_title: I love Minneapolis, but St. Paul leaves something to be desired.
job_title: Health Unit Coordinator in Minneapolis, MN
pros: I love the mission and workplace culture. I feel good about what I do and truly enjoy my work.
cons: I split my time between the Minneapolis and St Paul campuses and they are vastly different. The staff at St. Paul are stubborn about change, generally unpleasant and unhelpful.

job_title: Physician in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Competent specialists, well-equipped facilities, responsive IT staff, a complete array of neonatal equipment. This facility can handle anything.  The transport abilities of the facility are amazing.
cons: Big city traffic, not the safest area around the hospital. Cafeteria could have better hours and be priced more fairly.

review_title: I have seen so many kids grow up having been here 22 years.
job_title: R EEG Technologist in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Watching the children get well and survive some of the toughest things imaginable.
cons: Benefits could be better, considering it is a hospital.  Recognition is not very high.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Minneapolis, MN
pros: is great to work with kids, they have good pay and benefit
cons: very disrespectful management and HR will always be on the management side so no need to voice your concern you will end up been abused by your immediate boss if you say anything. If you are person with color good luck working for childrens. You will see the most unfair injustice done to you.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Taking care of kids, helping families and knowing patient care is important.
cons: No management, lack of protocols, wanting to move forward and try new things, growth potential is not great and hourly pay is lower than most area hospitals.

review_title: A wonderful place for children, it's the management that needs some change.
job_title: Front Desk and Appt Scheduler in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Good benefits, competitive salary, satisfying
cons: Too much micro managing, and customer service should be more important than speed

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Maple Grove, MN
pros: Children are the priority and are the highlight of working there.
cons:
End up staying there later than scheduled and having to close late.
Providers run behind often and are consistently rude to clinical staff.

job_title: Pharmacy Technician in Minneapolis, MN
pros:
Flexible
Great Team
Always learning something new.
Always looking for ways to improve healthcare for patients.
cons:
No career advancement.
Work every other weekend, rotate days and evenings.
Could use better communication.
Needs quicker turn around time for implementing improvements.

review_title: Great place, very focused on patient care
job_title: Interpreter in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Passionate coworkers who work hard to do their best for patients and families. Management (department specific) who do their best to acommodate schedules
cons: Occasional long shifts due to lack of overnight staff (department specific)

review_title: Great Company with few options for growth
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Pay is competitive in certain positions. Working environment is fun and playful.
cons: No room for growth at all. No promotions that can be obtained or grow into, thus no way to get a raise beyond yearly cost of living increases.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Maple Grove, MN
pros: MNA Union benefits, dental, 403 b, employer match 4%, health insurance, multicultural environment, meaningful work, Magnet hospital status, coworkers
cons: Expect Night shift for 4-5 years, management will take years to follow MNA Seniority schedules, hard to take approved vacation, no maternity leave

review_title: In the short time I have been with Children's I have learned a lot and the employees are always friendly
job_title: CSA in Minneapolis, MN
pros:
Working with kids is rewarding and amazing
Small ratio of patients
Great location
Great facility
cons:
Frequent weekend shifts
Parent's can be difficult at times

job_title: Infection Preventionist in Saint Paul, MN
pros: The organization, from leadership to support staff work to represent the values that the system has identified as integral to its mission.
cons: The email system is very outdated and parking availability is somewhat limited in the hospital.

review_title: A wonderful experience, a caring and innovative atmosphere!
job_title: Project Coordinator in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Dedication to personal development, recognition of talents and skills, desire to give the best care possible to every patient.
cons: The location is not ideal as my commute is long

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Team work is huge at Children's. It is nice not to be left in the dark. Well staffed for a hospital.
cons: Competition to get into certain areas you want to be in.

job_title: Emergency Department RN in New York, NY
pros: Coworkers, Patient population,  Ability to switch schedule around relatively easy
cons: Management, how RNs are treated like a number. Feel very disposable though it is a great place to work.

job_title: CNA, MBA in New York, NY
pros: Great staff, wonderful facility, great environment for advancement
cons: Low pay for the responsibilities

job_title: Health Unit Coordinator in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Work alongside people that really care and serve families in crisis
cons: There is Little opportunity for advancement.

job_title: Unit Coordinator in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Great Place to work. Flexible!
cons: Move around different departments a lot. It is difficult to learn when moving to different departments. But it depends with the position.

job_title: Triage Nurse in New York, NY
pros: Flexible hours, great benefits, nice work environment
cons: Communication between management and staff

job_title: Unit Operations Coordinator in New York, NY
pros: Love working with all of the fun and diverse people across the board
cons: Cut salaries of lower employees during the COVID pandemic, even when business returned to normal

job_title: in Edina, MN
pros: People are friendly. Strong learning environment. Positive mottos. The kids are always cute.
cons: HR approvals for benefits or hiring takes longer than necessary.

job_title: Patient Care Supervisor in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Cutting edge care, great benefits, ability to advance, supportive to nurses
cons: Lots of meetings and recent executive turnover (seems to be stabilizing now)

job_title: Radiologic Technologist in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Working w. children, other employees
cons: Management promotes a toxic environment, pay is well below the market in the Twin Cities.

job_title: Data Quality Analyst in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Flexible work hours, great coworkers and managers who accommodate your person life
cons: Teams need t work more in synergy

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Very flexible schedules. Nice bonuses for picking up shifts.
cons: Hard to get to every third weekend. Management never wants to offer every third.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Insurance benefits are not that bad
cons: Nurses can be generally rude and it’s hard not to get burnt out after some time. High turn over rate

job_title: Medical Assistant in West Saint Paul, MN
pros: It was a rewarding job, even in the most difficult situations.
cons: Management was not the greatest.

job_title: Human Resources Coordinator in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Friendly people, Managers are very supportive.
cons: Nothing to say specifically.

job_title: Health Unit Coordinator (HUC) in Maple Grove, MN
pros: Bonuses for the evenings/weekends. Good benefits. Good team members.
cons: Overall management of the company.

job_title: Healthcare Director in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Employee and patient experience is excellent
cons: Lots of transitional change occurring post-COVID

review_title: Great Mission for Healthcare of Children
job_title: Nurse Practitioner in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Great organization and Great Mission
cons: Really nothing that is a big Con

job_title: Clinical Research Associate II in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Great mission and vision to help children.
cons: Structure with management needs to be worked on. Old technology

job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Great people, doing amazing work
cons: Opportunities for non-clinical employees to grow and move within the organization

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Great values, I loved the people I worked with
cons: Sometimes the department was short staffed

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Great people to work with, supporting manager
cons: Changes occurring within organization currently

job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Minneapolis, MN
pros: The work is meaningful and Senior leadership is motivated
cons: Benefits package is slightly lacking

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Minneapolis, MN
pros:
* flexible hours.
* great location
cons: * Not much in pay increase.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Wonderful collaboration and great training
cons: The location isn’t the safest
